required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Development of Artificial Intelligence-assisted Glaucoma Screening Program

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This study will develop an artificial intelligence (AI) program for the screening of glaucoma.

detailed_description.textblock:
We have realized that the glaucomatous optic neuropathy is irreversible. But if early detection and early intervention can be performed to control the development of the disease, it can greatly reduce the blindness rate of glaucoma, improve the life quality and physiological and mental health of patients, and alleviate the social burden. Therefore, screening and early diagnosis of glaucoma is the focus of glaucoma prevention.
China has a population of 1.3 billion, which greatly increase the difficulty of disease screening. In recent years, the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) technology and modern medicine has made efficient and rapid disease screening possible.

primary_outcome.measure: The specificity of the algorithm for diagnosing glaucoma
primary_outcome.description: The specificity of the algorithm for diagnosing glaucoma will be calculated ...

primary_outcome.measure: The sensitivity of the algorithm for diagnosing glaucoma
primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity of the algorithm for diagnosing glaucoma will be calculated .

arm_group.description: Glaucomatous and Non-glaucomatous fundus images that have been taken from the last 5 years in Shanghai General hospital.

study_pop.textblock: Both glaucoma and non-glaucoma patients who can complete fundus image test will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- able to complete fundus images
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to complete fundus images

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
